com.gl.vn.me.ko.sample.instrumentation.example.transform

Class ClassFileTransformerExampleA

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gl.vn.me.ko.sample.instrumentation.util.AbstractClassFileTransformer
      • com.gl.vn.me.ko.sample.instrumentation.example.transform.ClassFileTransformerExampleA
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ClassFileTransformer

    public final class ClassFileTransformerExampleA
extends AbstractClassFileTransformer
    Transforms ExampleA class by modifying its private method incrementCounter() according to the following algorithm:
    • search for any field access inside the method incrementCounter()
    • if it's a write access and the JVM field signature is "I", replace the access by increment by 2
    According to the algorithm described above, the original method body
     {
        counter += incrementValue;
 }
    is transformed to something like
     {
        counter += 2;
 }
    Instantiability: explicit instantiation is forbidden; singleton (see INSTANCE field).
    Mutability: immutable.
    Thread safety: thread-safe.

    • Method Detail

      • acceptClassForTransformation

        protected final boolean acceptClassForTransformation(@Nullable
                                                     ClassLoader classLoader,
                                                     String className)
        Returns true only if className is equal to "com/gl/vn/me/ko/sample/instrumentation/example/ExampleA". The first argument classLoader is not used.
        Specified by:
        acceptClassForTransformation in class AbstractClassFileTransformer
        Parameters:
        classLoader - The defining loader of the class to be transformed. Can be null if the bootstrap loader.
        className - The name of the class in the internal form of fully qualified class and interface names as defined in "The Java Virtual Machine Specification". For example: "java/lang/Object".
        Returns:
        • true if the class should be transformed.
        • false if the class must be skipped without any transformations applied.
        See Also:
        AbstractClassFileTransformer.doTransform(CtClass)

      • doTransform

        @Nullable
protected final byte[] doTransform(CtClass ctClass)
                                      throws Exception
        Transformation is described in the description of ClassFileTransformerExampleA class.
        Specified by:
        doTransform in class AbstractClassFileTransformer
        Parameters:
        ctClass - Object that represents class file of a class to be transformed.
        Returns:
        An array of bytes in class file format (the result of the transform), or null if no transform was performed.
        Throws:
        Exception - If something goes wrong.
        See Also:
        AbstractClassFileTransformer.acceptClassForTransformation(ClassLoader, String), AbstractClassFileTransformer.transform(ClassLoader, String, Class, ProtectionDomain, byte[])
